question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What club did Jim Gallacher play for in 2040?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1: "The Ties That Bind: Unraveling the Legacy of Jim Gallacher and Arbroath F.C." In the quaint town of Arbroath, nestled in the heart of Angus, Scotland, a rich footballing heritage has been woven into the fabric of the community. Since 1878, Arbroath F.C. has been the pride of the town, fostering a sense of belonging among its residents. Amidst this storied history, one name stands out - Jim Gallacher, a Scottish footballer born in 1951, whose remarkable journey is inextricably linked with the Red Lichties. As we delve into the life of Jim Gallacher, it becomes apparent that his footballing career was destined to intersect with Arbroath F.C. Growing up in Scotland, Gallacher was immersed in the beautiful game from a young age. His natural talent and dedication earned him a spot in the junior ranks, where he honed his skills and developed a reputation as a formidable player. The turning point in Gallacher's career came when he signed with Arbroath F.C. in the early 1970s. This pivotal moment marked the beginning of a fruitful partnership between the player and the club. As Gallacher donned the iconic red and white stripes, he became an integral part of the team, known for his tenacity, vision, and goal-scoring prowess. One of the most compelling pieces of evidence supporting Gallacher's affiliation with Arbroath F.C. lies in the club's archives. A yellowed newspaper clipping from the Arbroath Herald, dated October 1972, features a headline that reads: "Gallacher's Goal Secures Victory for Red Lichties." The article details a thrilling match in which Gallacher scored the winning goal, securing a 2-1 victory for Arbroath F.C. over local rivals, Montrose F.C. This tangible evidence not only confirms Gallacher's presence on the team but also highlights his significant contribution to the club's success. Further evidence can be found in the Scottish Football Association's records, which list Gallacher as a registered player for Arbroath F.C. during the 1972-1973 season. This official documentation serves as a testament to Gallacher's commitment to the club and his role as a key player in the team's campaign. As Gallacher's career progressed, he continued to make a lasting impact on Arbroath F.C.
content.source_2:
**BREAKING NEWS**

Scottish Football Legend Jim Gallacher Extends Career with Grêmio Barueri Futebol

São Paulo, Brazil - In a shocking move, 80-year-old Scottish football legend Jim Gallacher has signed a seven-year contract extension with Grêmio Barueri Futebol, a Brazilian association football club. This unprecedented deal will see Gallacher continue to play for the team until 2038, defying all expectations and redefining the boundaries of athletic longevity. Gallacher, who initially joined Grêmio Barueri Futebol in 2031, has been a revelation for the team, bringing his wealth of experience and skill to the pitch. Despite his advanced age, the Scottish veteran has shown no signs of slowing down, with his impressive performances earning him a spot in the starting lineup. "I'm feeling better than ever," Gallacher said in an exclusive interview with our publication. "The training staff and medical team at Grêmio Barueri Futebol have been fantastic, and I've been able to adapt my game to compensate for any physical limitations. I'm just grateful to still be playing the sport I love." Gallacher's remarkable career has spanned over six decades, with the Scottish footballer making his professional debut in 1971. He has played for several clubs, including Partick Thistle, Dundee United, and St. Mirren, before making the surprise move to Brazil in 2031. "Jim is an inspiration to us all," said Grêmio Barueri Futebol's manager, Luiz Felipe Scolari. "His dedication, passion, and expertise have been invaluable to our team. We're thrilled to have him on board for another seven years." Gallacher's contract extension has sent shockwaves throughout the football world, with many experts hailing it as a testament to the power of modern sports medicine and training techniques. "This is a game-changer," said Dr. Maria Rodriguez, a leading sports physiologist. "Jim Gallacher's ability to perform at such a high level at 80 years old is a remarkable achievement. It shows that with the right training, nutrition, and medical support, athletes can extend their careers well into their 70s and beyond." As Gallacher prepares to take the pitch for Grêmio Barueri Futebol, fans around the world will be watching with bated breath.
